column4: just wanted to ask one last thing. is there a way so that when you open up apps in terminal it displays the app name in the header?
check the preferences.. there's supposed to be some kind of dynamic title thing.. I never got it to work though
can't find anything :(
it's in Edit, "Current profile" ..
but as I said.. I've never been able to make it work sensibly
yeh mines already set on replace initial title :(
yea.. so is mine.. it's never replaced anything so far
lol. even on intrepid :/
ok.. be right back
thanks
seg faults.. someone made a mistake when programming compiz.. not a lot you can do about it
ah k. then that's not my problem :/
probably not
if I give you the dmesg dump over pastebin would you be able to tell me which line is giving me the error message for no webcam audio input?
or what the problem may be?
I can't promise anything but I can give it a try
see what you can do: http://pastebin.com/f733e607c
how'd you do?
it's a big file.. I see your other sound card I think
it's probably something under USB
http://pastebin.com/f733e607c
sorry
that second pastebin was an accident
if I give you the device's number would that help?
=) no worries.. I've found the webcam and the sound chip.. (looks like a sonixj whatever that is)
ah cool. do you know why sound isn't working?
it just menations registering a usb sound interface... but it isn't complaining about anything..
is it advising I register a usb sound interface or has one already been registered?
do you see the sound device in your volume properties? does it show up if you do "cat /proc/asound/cards" ?
it's there
USB-Audio - USB camera
ok.. but not working?
ie you can't record anything from it
not working :/ and can't record
do you get some kind of error message when you try? or just silence?
just silence
actually
I get silence when I try to call cam test on skype
but when I try to test my audio settings on skype i get an error message
might be a skype problem too
I tried recording on gnome-sound-recorder to no avail :/
what do you make of that?
hmm... don't really know.. hard to diagnose without some kind of error
do you use skype?
yup
well I was getting an error message before but no-longer for some weird reason - that's after i changed my gnome audio settings
are there ways to configure mic input other than via gnome?
well.. there are alsa-configuration tools that doesn't need gnome.. but they don't do anything that the gnome tools doesn't do
what's you sound capture settings for Sound Prefs?
you mean in system, preferences, sound? I use pulseaudio
and then how do you modify the pulse audio settings?
oh.. but skype doesn't use pulseaudio. it uses alsa
so it ignores my pulseaudio settings
so when you use skype what do you do with the gnome settings?
ah k
I just set skype to use hw:Audigy2,0 which is the alsa name of my soundblaster card
so if skype overrides settings for the cam while running, should I be able to configure microphone settings fully from skype?
that doesn't come up as an option in my skype :/

it doesn't really override settings.. alsa is the base system for your system.. it selects a driver for the sound card and makes sound devices available to the system.. pulseaudio uses these devices so you can do neat things like move the sound from one soundcard to another... alsa is still there, behind the scenes, doing the actual work on the sound card
do you use camorama?
skype just ignore pulseaudio.. and goes directly to alsa..gnome-volume-manager also configures the alsa settings.. there is another configuration dialog for pulseaudio
nope.. my webcam doesn't work with it..
my usb sound card does some weird things with the volume too.. fortunately I can change the volume on my speakers instead
I'm installing gnome-volume-manager now. I didn't have it for some weird reason :/
hmm.. I think it's installed by default.. odd
it should be the dialog that pops up if you right click on the little speaker in the top right..
or rather, right click and select volume control
sorry.. it's called gnome-volume-control.. not manager
ah k
I wonder what I just installed... :/
give it a try =)
I did, but it wouldn't launch under gnome-volume-manager so I'm removing it
ok
actually you might be able to help me with something else. For some reason I adjusted some setting and when I click the volume up and volume down buttons on the key board they nolonger do anything
actually when I select capture on the volume control it shows an X over it as if to say mute
try unmuting it?
additionally when I go into microphone volume settings the microphone is always mute
if I unmute it then click close it is remuted when I open it again
it might be a driver problem too.. if you can't change the settings
anyhow thanks for your help
you're welcome to what little there was of it =)
i'm distressed that I can no longer use the buttons to make volume changes
I've got no idea what I've changed
hopefully a reboot fixes it but I highly dout it
mm.. I can't really help you with that.. the extra buttons work on my laptop but I have no idea why.. it just worked out of the box
mine did to
I've just done something and they no longer work
just this evenening
I don't even know what software is responsible.. might be gnome.. or X.. or something else
whilst trying to get the webcam audio input working :/
don't worry too much, I'll see what a reboot does and cross my fingers
have a good night
you too
